title: At-a-Glance Weather Disappearing
content:
[There are many posts about this issue on various phones, but they've all been locked so I'm starting a new one.]

The At-A-Glance temperature on my Pixel 4a Home screen keeps disappearing. It comes back after a reboot but then will disappear again. This happened when the phone was on Android 10, and now on Android 11.

This also happened regularly on my Nokia 6.1, an Android One phone running Android 10.

How on earth does this keep happening? A weather widget is such a basic feature, but this problem is now years old and is still happening on Google's own Pixel phones running Android 11.

title: Homescreen Folder accidental removal ?
content:
As like many of us, I have various Folders on my P5 homescreen.  To be precise, one named Forums, for some reason, today the whole folder is gone completely, just a gap where it was.

Not sure if it's coincidence or not, but this happened after I done a OTA security update.

Anyway, I do replicate everything that's on my P5 on my Samsung Galaxy Tab S7+, so I just sent a email to myself with a link to each Forum website and then saved them again on my P5 and now have my Forum Folder on my homescreen with all the various Forums I frequent.

Is there a way that I cannot accidently delete this or any Folder on my homescreen again with it asking me something like " Are You sure" ?  

I must have long pressed this by mistake and dragged it to the Remove option that pops up at the top of the screen....hard to do by mistake, I think, but its happened.  What has also happened in the past, is that a Folder on my homescreen moves to the next screen, again, must be me doing it by mistake.  So a option to prevent both these scenarios from happening again would be great.

Hope you get what I'm on about, any suggestions ?

Thanks

title: Unable to show weather info for this location
content:
I have tried all the suggestions found here and internet-wide.
I can't reply to this thread as it was locked
https://support.google.com/pixelphone/thread/92874133?hl=en

The weather was working fine while not at home. 
At home, I get "unable to show weather info for this location [my postal code]. If I change the location/postal code, it shows weather info.
Fix: when at home, turned off the WiFi and refresh the weather widget, using carrier data. Weather info was updated for my location. Turned on WiFi.
Hope this bit of information will help some of the pixel users facing the issue "unable to show weather info for this location"

title: Direct Dial Widgets Disappearing
content:

title: Pixel 3 Touch Screen/Gesture navigation issues
content:
Gesture Navigation
Not sure what's happening with my Pixel 3 but the swipe home gesture navigation stopped working. I can still swipe back and forth to get to other apps and swiping from the edge to go back still works. The other navigation options work fine tho. If I do the swipe left option to go to another app in a recent app and then quickly swipe up I can go home.With the gesture navigation enabled in apps like WhatsApp I can't tap the area to start texting.

Touch Screen 
In fullscreen apps especially games the lower section where the navigation gestures are doesn't work during gaming but work otherwise.
There is also a section from the top of the volume button to about 2-3cm down and horizontally that doesn't touch most times either. Like for example when I go to the Play store search for app and then tap on the app on the big horizontal green install button I cannot tap it I have to scroll to get that button out of the area and then press install.

I have tried factory resetting however that almost locked me out of the phone because the lower section when you're just starting up that says "start" I couldn't touch it. I had to use the magnification option to get it a little bigger and then repeatedly tap it.

title: Feature Request
content:
I'm running the Pixel Launcher on Android 11 on a Pixel 3. I've tried other launchers but keep coming back to the stock launcher because I just love the overall feel of it.

But it is so bare-bones with such limited options for any sort of customization, it could definitely be improved. I suggest you consider the Lawnchair Launcher, which is open source but which is on the verge of going defunct because of a lack of support. You could mine it for gold in the form of features.

Some things that would be awesome:

 - The ability to arrange the home pages, and to set our own default page rather than being locked in to the farthest left page as the default. For example, I prefer the center page to be my default, making for shorter travel back and forth to the extremes, and because so many wallpapers are center-weighted, they look weird when you default to the farthest left page and cause the wallpaper to scroll to the right.

- Make the placement of the At-a-Glance widget optional. Currently, it takes up real estate at the top of the default page, with no way to move it or remove it.

- The ability to set an action for sliding your finger up or down on an icon, rather than just opening when tapping on it. This is a great option for (for example) quick access to the most frequently used app in a folder.

- The ability to hide apps in the app drawer. This is nice in the case of apps that bring premium features to other apps, but don't really do anything unto themselves. We may need to have them resident on the phone, but it's nice to not have them cluttering things up if we don't actually use them.

title: Pixel3A stopped working, I did a hard reset, after logging back in it shut down again, will not boot
content:
Yesterday morning I woke up to find that my Pixel 3a had shut itself down, even though I had been charging it overnight. I switched to another charging outlet, but the phone still would not start up. I decided to attempt a factory reset, so I held down POWER + VOLUME DOWN for a few seconds, after which I got the "no command" screen. I pressed POWER + VOLUME UP to get the menu options. At this point the phone started acting erratically. It would only show the menu options for a very short amount of time before rebooting and kicking me back to the "no command" screen. Finally I got it to actually begin the factory reboot. It displayed a black screen with small white text at the bottom saying something like "wiping /data..." It seemed to be stuck in this state, but I was afraid to interrupt the process, so I left it overnight (plugged into a working charger).

This morning I woke up to find nothing had changed, so I used POWER + VOLUME DOWN to restart the device again. Once again I ended up at the "no command" screen, so I used POWER + VOLUME UP to get to the menu. The phone seemed to be acting less erratically now, and I was able to select Factory Reset again easily. This time I got the "wiping /data..." message again, and it only lasted a few seconds before prompting me to restart. After restarting, I was able to begin the account setup process normally, so I thought I was in the clear.

One thing worth mentioning is that this is a company phone, and I had previously been using my company-managed gmail address for it, but during the reset process I had trouble with the 2-Auth on that account, so I switched to my personal gmail address instead. Nevertheless, everything seemed to be going smoothly, I was able to connect to wifi and set up my fingerprint again, and then the phone started downloading some recommended apps. I could see that the battery was fully charged, so I left it to finish the app downloads.

Within less than half an hour, the phone shut itself down again. This time I was unable to restart it no matter what I tried: holding POWER for over 30 seconds, holding POWER + VOLUME DOWN for over 30 seconds, holding POWER + VOLUME UP for over 30 seconds, holding POWER + VOLUME DOWN + VOLUME UP for over 30 seconds, plugging it into the power charger again, etc.

As far as I can tell the phone is completely unresponsive, and to make it more frustrating, any attempt at searching the web for solutions to this problem just leads me to instructions on how to do a factory reset, which I already did twice, and which is now impossible to attempt again because I can't even get into that boot menu anymore.

IF YOU ARE READING THIS AND PLANNING TO TELL ME TO DO A FACTORY RESET, PLEASE READ AGAIN THOROUGHLY FROM THE TOP. I HAVE ALREADY DONE A FACTORY RESET, IT SEEMED TO WORK, AND NOW I CANNOT EVEN ACCESS THE MENU TO ATTEMPT ANOTHER FACTORY RESET. THANK YOU.

title: How do I enable youtube music to show up on my locked screen and my notifications drop down area
Android 11 Bubbles - Learned behaviour & notification clearing
content:
I understand the notification UI changes of Android 11 are massive and may have some learning curve however, I have some gripes which I feel could greatly improve its functionality.

Bubbles:
The default for the native notification bubble to apear at the same spot on the left of the screen is rather frustrating and I find myself wanting to disable the feature altogether rather than move it to my desired spot every time. I know the previous messenger chat heads which the bubbles are styled after had an element of machine learning in which the app learnt where you moved the bubble to and made that the new default.

Notification panel:
Related to the updated notification UI you are now required to swipe each individual message to dismiss, or click "clear all" as opposed to the previous option where you could swipe away all notifications grouped within a specific app. For example Whatsapp where I have several chats which I do not regularly check, every time the app refreshes I have to swipe each chat seperately or click clear all which then clears other app notifications as well. Would be nice if the option to swipe an entire app's notification away again.

Just my 2c

title: Unable to turn off Home screen (launcher?) sideways scroll animations in Android 11 on Pixel 3
content:
I always turn off the animations to ensure that I have a fast responding phone.

Since updating my Pixel 3 to Android 11 I have noticed that the sideways scroll animation on the home screen has retained a bounce, even when animations are turned off. To me this is unnecessary as it  makes the scroll appear as if it takes longer.

My OG Pixel 1 running Android 10, also has animations turned off, and has no bounce when scrolling side to side on the home screen.

So now - in this respect - my 2016 Pixel 1 looks faster than the Pixel 3 :-/

So far I have tried: 
Using 'Remove animations' in Accessibility settings
Turning off animations using Developer options (Turned off Window animation scale, Transition animation scale, and Animator duration scale.)
Checking the Pixel Launcher app settings - I didn't find any useful settings 

Turning on 'Remove animations' in Accessibility settings made no change the the side scroll bounce. Using the Developer options route reduces the bounce slightly, but it's still noticeable compared to Android 10.

Are there any other settings I could try?

title: How can I recover data from boot loop - Pixel XL and Nexus 6P - and then wipe them clean?
content:
Long time Android user, first time poster -

Yes, I'm aware that I'm using older models. I typically buy them refurbished and have never really had many problems, up until recently.

When my trusty Nexus 6P started having battery life problems, I got the next iteration, the Pixel XL.

Everything was fine until last week when the Pixel started boot-looping. Figured it was hardware related as I dropped it, but it worked fine for a couple of days after the drop.

I ordered myself a refurbished Pixel 2 XL and then popped my SIM card into the Nexus 6P so I could answer texts in the meantime - the Nexus 6P works, but just has to stay plugged in all the time.

The Nexus 6P has been sitting on my desk, plugged in. It worked just peachy for 2 days, then that started boot looping too - which tells me this might be app / software related and not hardware related.

The conspiracy theorist in me says that Google can somehow actively brick older phones so that I'll buy a new one...coincidentally the Android 11 update and Pixel 5 are coming out...guess that's a gripe for a different post, but thought I'd throw that out there.

What I'd like to know is the following:

#1 - Is there a way to recover any data from either of these phones? I believe the vast majority of my data gets cloud backup, but I think some of the unsaved pics in messages might be gone forever.

#2 - Once my Pixel 2 XL arrives, I'm going to dispose of both of these. Aside from physically destroying them, how can I wipe them clean of my data?

#3 - Can I avoid this happening in the future? Do I have to listen to my iPhone shaming friends and go to the Dark side?

Thank you,

Mark

title: Feature request: bring back the suggested apps/search bar/app drawer access on the recents screen.
content:
A lot of Pixel people (including myself) absolutely loved the feature in Android 10 of having suggested apps, a search bar and access to the app drawer from anywhere, as they were present on the recents screen. 

Personally, I really like the suggested apps because they were really accurate. These kind of AI features is the main reason why I bought a Pixel (and why people love Pixel phones - because of their unique AI features which other phones don't have). Having the app suggestions only on the dock now seems like a step back. Also, losing access to the search bar and app drawer from anywhere were really handy features, especially seeing how much space there is on the bottom of the recents screen, where now you can only find a "screenshot" and "select" button. 

Some sources which prove that people loved the feature:
- AndroidPolice post about the introduction of dynamic app suggestions on the home screen, top upvoted comments:
"What they should really add (back) is app suggestions to recents" 
"I really hope they add these suggestions back to the recents menu; that's where I find them useful."
"It saves me from having to swipe up the app drawer because the app I want to open is probably already going to be suggested at the bottom. I can't believe they removed that and for what, a screenshot button."

- Reddit post about introduction of Android 11, top upvoted comments:
"I'm not a big fan of the change to the recent apps menu. The view seems a lot more clunky now that you can no longer use the Google search bar, click on a suggested app or go to your app drawer." 
"The search and suggested apps in the recent apps menu was one of my most used features. Really hating that those are gone.
"Suggested apps as an option on all my home screens seems like a step back." 
"Oh god, the bottom bit for the launcher is actually gone? I've been so accustomed to tapping the suggestions (because they're that good) that I don't even scroll through the previous apps anymore."
"Damn I wouldn't have updated if I'd known 😖 What a dumb change. Hopefully they add an option to get these features back"

Also on 9to5google's Android 11 feature overview, they are mainly talking about losing this feature:
- "RIP overview suggestions. Used it daily."
- "You can turn it off in Home settings luckily. I love suggested apps but didn't like them on the home screen"

I really appreciate all the hard work that went into developing Android 11. But to me, and a lot of other people, it would be a good decision to bring this feature back, maybe as a toggle which you can turn on or off. 

Thank you.

title: Android 11: more problems and no answers for what we need
content:
Hi, 

I had to flash my pixel with last build for Android 10, cause Android 11 is simply not working properly.

Notifications, my old 3 buttons in the bottom, most of apps... What was that!?

I did it 4 times with clean update and without any special settings. I made it with Android tools to be sure phone was wiped correctly.
Nothing. 

My pixel 3 XL simply doesn't work with 11.

I have no idea what happened exactly and honestly, all new features are just more problems to setup that, like "conversations", one theses that not working with most of of social apps, or bubbles not working, etc.

And we're waiting for settings for notifications sound and ringtone separately, since Oreo.

How many ppl it takes to say that things like wellbeing or setting sounds are not mandatory for every people? Why going so far with wellbeing and settings that is way too intrusive that I can't deactivate it with 11 even if this release work with my phone? 

And when can we expect a real good release for 11? 

I'm discouraged. 

Love ideas, like conversations, like bubbles, even wellbeing is a good idea if people need it!
BUT... I HATE when you force ideas everywhere, especially Wellbeing and sound settings.
And for now, all I want is a fresh and GOOD update for Android 11 that will work, and at least, less wellbeing dependant, and obviously... 2 settings for notifications sounds and ringtone AGAIN.


P.s.: sorry if I made mistakes, English is not my first language.

Sephî.

title: Notifications squished and not expanding properly in pull-down notification drawer
content:
In the last ~3 weeks (I think since the July 2020 security update) I've noticed my notification drawer (which you drag down with your fingers) is no longer expanding further than about 50% the height of the screen. Additionally, it no longer allows me to scroll the list of notifications within the drawer. As such, the notifications in the drawer are squished and some scroll off the bottom of the drawer and I cannot see them at all. See sample screenshots at the bottom of this message.

Normally, I would just use my fingers (have tried 1, 2, 3, 4 fingers) to expand the drawer down to the full height of the screen (and once it's full height, I used to be able to scroll the list of notifications independently) but now it just expands the shortcut buttons section (the top row of the open notification drawer) rather than the notifications section itself.

I've not changed any settings relating to the notification drawer, and in fact, I cannot even find any settings to customised the look/feel/layout of the notification draw so I believe it was a change made as part of an update rather than something I've changed.

I've also tested with my launcher (I use Nova Launcher Pro) and the default pixel launcher - the notification drawer doesn't change and works the same no matter which launcher I use so I don't think it's an issue with Nova Launcher.

Example screenshots (two with FB messenger, one with YT music)
https://imgur.com/F48r6Xm
https://imgur.com/41YpqyX
https://imgur.com/P1lxXE4

This is what happens when I try to expand the drawer - it just expands the shortcut icons row at the top
https://imgur.com/ZnVWXiQ
category: Homescreen and Launcher, Google Pixel 4 XL

title: Pixel 3a will did not restore Home screen and apps after factory reset
content:
Adding this because the other thread i found did not have the correct solution posted. 

The problem was that during phone re-setup, when it shows the option to "Transfer data from old phone", i chose "No" when I should actually have chosen "YES" and then selected "Can't use old phone" which will then lead you to the option to restore from available backups. 

I did another Factory Reset and did this and it successfully restored my phone exactly as it was before the Factory Reset.

title: Why is Google's design language for app icons so lazy?
content:
Why can't Google design thoughtful icons that don't utilize a white border on their own native launcher? 

I'm not talking about the 'adaptive' part. I'm talking about, Why do many of Google's own icons require adapting in the first place? That's just flat lazy.

At least give us the choice to ditch the white border for a 'frosted filling', wherein our wallpaper bleeds through. 

Top circled row? Fugly. Boring. (Sorry for dragging you into this, Philips Hue)

Bottom? Fine! Good! Thoughtful, even.￼

Surrounding an icon with glaring white to make it circular isn't a design language. It's just...adequate.
category: Homescreen and Launcher, Google Pixel 4 XL

title: Google Pay on Pixel 4 XL requires me to unlock the phone twice every time
content:
Not sure if this is a common problem or if it's just me, but every time I use my P4XL to pay in-store I end up having to tap my phone twice on the POS before the transaction goes though. Basically, each transaction goes like this:

Unlock phone and open Google Pay through power menu
Wave phone at contactless card reader
Get error message that I need to authorize payment using my face and transaction stops
Awkward moment between me and the cashier until they notice they need to hit some sort of redo button so I can try paying again
Wave phone at contactless card reader a second time
Transaction complete

Correct me if I'm wrong, but shouldn't this be a more seamless process? I should be able to just wave the phone once and be done if I already have the phone unlocked right?

I imagine I never had this issue on my pixel 2XL because I could hold my fingerprint on the reader as I tapped to pay. The same cannot be done with face unlock.

Credit to chrispgriffin on Reddit for describing the issue. I am copying his post as it describes the issue I have perfectly since getting a Pixel 4 XL. 

There is no Google Pay support forum so I'm posting here as it relates to Face Unlock.

title: auto arrange icons on home screen alphabetically
content:
I want all my home screen icons to be listed by alphabetical order.

In particular, if I install a new app, and drag its icon to the home screen, I want it to be inserted there in alphabetical order (i.e. automatically re-arranging all the icons which come after it).

This is the way that the app drawer already works.  I want my home screen (which only has my favorite apps) to behave the same.

What I currently am forced to do whenever I add something is manually drag many icons around.  Total stupid pain.  It keeps getting worse as I add more stuff.

I have web searched this, and I found nothing for stock Android 10 (like my Pixel 4 XL).

But the question is constantly asked, for example:
https://androidforums.com/threads/alphabetical-order-for-apps-on-home-screen.1227021/
https://forum.xda-developers.com/lg-g8/help/auto-arrange-icons-t3922014

Did I miss something, or is this a known major defect with Android?

title: Pixel 3XL bug using Gesture Navigation on Android 10. (Happening since Android 10 release)
content:
Do we still not have a resolution to this bug?

Original thread where I found about how to replicate the bug.

[https://support.google.com/pixelphone/thread/13553491?hl=en&dark=1](https://support.google.com/pixelphone/thread/13553491?hl=en&dark=1)

Basically what happens is that when I'm using the "Gesture Navigation" from the System Navigation settings, whenever I swipe up to open the app drawer and exit out swiping from the right of the screen. The 5 main icons on the home screen become unresponsive and do not respond accurately to touch at times. When I do the same thing but exit out swiping to the left part of the screen instead, the issue never happens. Also, this is one way of fixing the issue whenever it happens.

​

I've recorded videos to help visualize the issue.  They're basically the same, but I made one while on safe mode and after a reset.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=URGlfZlnCvw&feature=share](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=URGlfZlnCvw&feature=share)  \- safe mode

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1r9LNINohHA&feature=share](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1r9LNINohHA&feature=share)  \- factory reset

​

You don't have to press the buttons at the start to replicate the bug. That is for me to show support what's that tapping the home icons works without issues before doing the bug. 


Any help is appreciated. Thank you in advance.

Same behavior is with Assistant gesture from bottom corner, it requires two gestures. Also simple swipe from bottom to open app list behaves the same and requires two swipes as first it just shows the bottom bar.

Any tips how to pinpoint the reason for this? Some recent app update maybe, but how can they affect all screens on the phone? I did uninstall Swiftkey as a test, but no change.

title: Pixel 2XL stuck in boot loop
content:
My Google Pixel 2XL died one morning so I left it to charge. When I turned it on, it was stuck in a boot loop (didn't get passed the google logo screen). After searching for ways to fix this online I found that applying a Rescue OTA to the device has solved a few people's issues. I followed the instructions here, that detailed how to do this. However, when I type the commands fastboot devices and adb devices  into my terminal (I'm using a mac), it didn't list any devices.

I have no idea how to fix this. Google customer supports only suggestion was that I factory reset my phone but I haven't backed up my photos and was hoping to do that after I've exhausted all my other options.

I found  this post with a similar issue where the person said they installed the wrong ADB driver but the answer to this didn't help me either. This person mentioned that their phone was stuck in a boot loop due to "over-full memory" and if this is so, I believe my phone might be stuck in a boot loop for the same reason (I've used over 90% of my storage).

title: Pixel 3a, Screen SUPER bright, can barely see, mostly just white.
content:
Hello, 

4 months ago I got a Pixel 3a. The recently the screen began to flicker / act weird when 10 PM came around. I'm not sure if this was the night light or something else. But it would only happen for a split second then resume working normally...sometimes the screen would still look weird but it was readable.

Last night I was outside listening to Spotify on my Pixel 3a. All of a sudden the screen wacked out similar to before except it didn't go back to normal! So now the "Always Display" looks normal in black/white, when I turn the phone screen on, I can BARELY see stuff on the screen. It's BRIGHT WHITE, I can barely make out whats on the screen, usually you can't see at all. When I restart the phone by holding power, I can just barely see the Google/Welcome logo pop up.

I was able to just barely navigate to the Display Settings section, but I literally cannot make out ANYTHING on this page when I click it. It's just too white. So some stuff I can just barely see, and others I cannot see at all.

At one point I tilted my phone and tried turning the screen on and it worked normally! for 1 split second, then reverted back to the super bright screen.

I've NEVER dropped my phone. It's been in the case since day 1 with my on-screen protector. 

How do I fix this? What phone number do I call for Canada support? Everywhere I click on the pixel 3 support page I'm sent in a loop. "Contact Us" links just loop me to pages with basic info and I can't speak to anybody! No phone numbers are listed anywhere. 

Please help.

title: No weather in "at a glance" widget
content:
Since I have my phone, I have never had the weather information displayed in the "At a glance" widget on my home screen. I have seen several old posts on this and on other forums of people having the same or similar problems, and I have already tried the following suggestions from these:

1. Turn on and off weather updates and weather update for current location from Google app customise settings.
2. Uninstall and reinstall Google app updates.
3. Join the Google app beta and leave it again.

None of these has solved the problem. Contrary to some other reports, the weather info has never appeared for a while and then disappeared again. I have never seen it at all. Also the toggles for the weather updates settings do not automatically turn off, they always stay the way I set them.

The Google app has location permission as well as Pixel launcher. I do not have my location turned on all the time, but I've left it on for more than a day and still no luck. I'm not sure if it's related, but I also do not see any weather info in my Google feed, although weather updates are turned on in the settings.

title: Notification drawer - delayed response & blank notifications
content:
For at least two or three months I have been having problems with the Pixel Launcher on my P4 XL 128 GB.  The notifications are very delayed but only sometimes (more often then not though).  The prime examples of this are as follows:

1) YouTube Music - When I have been listening to music and I swipe up to close the app YouTube Music still appears in the notification drawer for up to 10 seconds after the app has been closed.  
2)  Phone Calls - After I end a phone call it will still appear in the notification drawer for up to 10 seconds afterward as if the call is still in progress even after the call has ended and the phone app has been closed.

Last night a new issue also appeared.  I swiped down my notification drawer and all the items were blank (see picture).  I have already tried a factory reset and the issue still persists.  I tried booting into safe mode and it didn't do it, then I booted back into regular mode and it didn't do it either, but after a day or so it is back to doing the same thing again.  This is not a memory issue and the only apps running in the background are Reddit and the Ring app.

This is extremely annoying.  Any advice would be greatly appreciated.  The device has the latest March 2020 update applied.

title: Problem with "Recent Apps" view after updating to Android 10
content:
This issue tracker post describes it the best:

https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/137310926

Essentially, clearing out apps in the "Recent Apps" view doesn't actually clear them when you reopen "Recent Apps". And if you tried to open a previously cleared app from the "Recent Apps" view, it throws an error message saying that the app isn't available.

It isn't resolved even with the latest October security patch even though it is marked as fixed. The issue persists for both pill button navigation and gesture navigation. Any suggestions for a fix I could try or should I wait for another update?

title: Overview/gesture support for third party launchers?
content:
Hello! I got my Pixel in October and I absolutely love it. There's only one flaw though. I've been a lifetime user of Nova Launcher, which has always been consistently up to date with gestures and the latest aesthetics to come to Android. However, I noticed that in Android 10 (and Android Pie as well) transitions and animations between the Overview menu and the home screen are very choppy. 

I've done some research and discovered that this issue is caused by Google integrating the Overview menu with the launcher, which is a fantastic idea. However, it cripples third-party launchers because the app has to have system permissions in order to modify the Overview menu. So, this makes the Pixel Launcher the only launcher that supports Android 10 animations and gestures properly. The only way to solve this is by rooting your device, which I don't want to do. 

I know that Google had a similar issue introducing the Android 10 gesture nav system and making it compatible with 3rd party launchers. My question: is Google going to eventually fix this, and allow third-party launchers to modify the Overview menu? I would really hate to see Android turn into iOS, with no options available.

Thanks!
category: Homescreen and Launcher, Google Pixel 3a XL

title: Please add a setting in a future Android 10 update to allow screenshot alert noise to be disabled
content:
Please can you add the ability to turn-off screenshot sound in a future Android 10 release.

I expect to have a toggle under Settings > Sound > Advanced > Other Sounds and Vibrations called "Screenshots". Many other phones have this, not sure why Google have to be different.



Only workaround is to turn your "Phone" volume slider down to vibrate only, as the volume for the screenshots is controlled by this setting, meaning you could miss calls if you forget to turn this back on.

I understand it's a legal requirement in some countries to not allow camera sounds to be disabled, but I've never heard of anything around taking screenshots, so this seems like a bug to me, given plenty of other phones let you do this.

Thanks

title: The pixel4 screen has green light on the upper and lower parts
content:
When the screen displays dark pictures in full screen (like the two in the album, note: not a pure black picture. When pure black, the OLED is not illuminated, so it is not observed), you can see green light in the upper and lower parts of the screen under weak light intensity (such as indoor, in the dim place).
This situation has always existed since the purchase of a mobile phone. But recently I found that when I touch the screen, it flashes (sometimes it flashes by itself).

title: Google Lens & Multi-tasking, gone with wind?
content:

Android 10 was the culprit which leads me to assume the feature will simply return with enough time. Being able to seamlessly grab images was so utterly useful in tracking down artists from social media & memes. Now, we are left with the ability to grab text & share but a much slower process in searching for similar images. title: Is my Pixel 2 screen broken? Suddenly went to BSoD, and will now not display anything
content:
My screen suddenly went black, and it will not display anything no matter what I try. I've tried soft restarts, and nothing displays, no vibrations no sounds. The battery was fine when this happened, at about 50%. I've plugged it into my PC and into an outlet, while charging it, trying to factory reset, but nothing displays, no sounds no vibrations. I let the battery drain, and was able to see a flashing red light at the top right corner when pressing and holding the power button (which means the phone is too drained to turn on). I then charged it again and the flashing red light is gone, but still will not display anything, no vibrations, and no sound. 

I watched a YouTube video and as suggested, put the phone in the freezer for an hour, pressed hard all over the screen and back-plate, tapped all the buttons quickly, held them down in various combinations for minutes on end. Nothing seems to be bringing this phone back to life.

Seems like a hardware issue, is my phone broken? Have had it just under two years, and warranty is only for one year I believe. This sucks.

title: Android 10 bug – App switcher creates "Ghost" app
content:
My pixel updated itself to Android 10 this morning. I was saddened to almost immediately notice a bug:
1. Run an app (eg. Clock).
2. Touch "Back" button to exit app.
3. Touch "App Switcher" button to see app still running.
4. Swipe up to "kill" app.
5. Touch "App Switcher" button to see app still running – or is it?
6. Touch app to receive message "App isn't available".
The app has become a "ghost"!
It gets weirder:
7. Run another app.
8. Touch "App Switcher" button. Watch as second app screenshot shrinks, then morphs into that ghost app.
9. Touch app to again receive message "App isn't available".
So far, nothing else seems broken, and this isn't serious for me. It's just unsettling that something is noticeably unwell and reducing my faith in my previously trusty Pixel.

title: Android 10 swipe gesture for Home
content:
Installed Android 10 the day it came out (I know, I know...wait for the bugs first...) and mostly like it.  Issue I have is with gestures.  

Prior to gestures, tapping the Home button would minimize an open app and return you to the Home screen (whichever Home screen was last open, primary or one of the secondaries).  Tapping it again would take you to your Primary Home screen.  

Using gestures, swiping up from the bottom of the screen with an app open returns you to whichever Home screen was open, but I haven't found a way to return to my Primary Home screen without having to manually swipe through the pages to get there.  Swiping up from the bottom of the screen without an app open just opens the app drawer, or, if you do it right, gets you to the list of open/recent apps (and that gesture is a whole 'nother issue and topic!)

Am I missing something or does anyone have a workaround?

title: Android 10 update causes swipe-to-unlock issue
content:
Before the Android 10 update, you could easily flick your thumb up to reach the unlock screen. You needed to only swipe about 5-10% of the length of the screen, and could do it with one hand.

Since the update, it now requires a much longer swipe. I can get it on the first try every time, IF I SWIPE 20 or 30% OF THE SCREEN LENGTH OR MORE. It sometimes takes two hands to unlock the phone now, or some awkward contorting to try to cover that much in a single swipe, but always requires being cognizant of how long my swipe is. 

Basically, the update took something that was easy and user friendly and made it awkward and sometimes difficult. And being that the fingerprint scanner is so abysmal that it only works for a day or two after it's programmed, this swiping issue is a real problem.

title: Pixel 3 XL frozen screen
content:
Apps on my Pixel 3 XL freezes when turning on the phone two times. This is happening for most apps like Google Play Store, Google Play Console, Audible, almost all apps. The only apps that I tested and keeps responsive are Google Mail and Google Maps. All others are frozen until I interact with the android system in any way like dragging the statusbar down or pressing home button. The apps are processing the events. Like when I click the Play button in a player app, it starts and stops, but the UI is not responding like showing pressed states.

Again steps to reproduce:
1. Open PlayStore App
2. Press power button to turn off
3. Press power button to turn on (apps keep responsive)
3. Press power button to turn off
4. Press power button to turn on (apps are not responsive)

Google Chrome reacts in this case to show a black screen.
This also happens if device is running in save mode.

Other attributes of this phone.
- No sim card. But I remember that I also had issues when I was using it with SimCard
- Latest Updates installed

title: Is there any way to escalate my issues i'm facing with B2X and google support team??
content:
Hi,

about 3 weeks ago my pixel 2 screen turned black all of a sudden but the phone was functioning fine with everything else like Mic, speaker etc.

I raised a ticket and my phone was picked up in 2 days with an assurance to have it returned in 7 working days.

Its been 3 weeks now and neither the service team nor customer care team have a proper understanding of the issue or they are just holding back to find excuses every single time I interact with them on call or emails.

They exclaimed that my phone has screen damage, water damage, display chip faulty and what not. And when I questioned they said it was erroneously typed.

There are about 20 mails back and forth (until today) in which there are different sort of judgements and procrastination from the google support team.

They keep on saying that 'we have sent you the estimation of INR 9,500' but i never received any such email until this day even after checking my spam mailbox. 

My only question is that if there is a physical damage which has happened internally it should be covered under the warranty terms. I even shared a video with my technician who picked up my device and there is no physical damage on the phone to which even he agreed as well.

I am facing a lot of issues with my phone gone away. Please Help!!!

My initial service ticket number GL0074545

Adit

title: Pixel (1) Stuck in On-Off Loop
content:
Was watching a youtube video (using the default app) when screen suddenly glitched up and pixel froze.

After about 10 seconds, pixel started reboot cycle:  Google logo appears, stays there for 19--21 seconds, phone screen goes blank for 4--5 seconds, and then back to the google logo in an endless loop.  No interaction with phone screen or buttons.

1.  Tried plugging phone into charger, no impact.  Does not seem to register that charger is plugged in.

2.  Attempted to power phone off by holding down power button.  No effect; reboot cycle just continues.

3.  Attempted to hold power button and volume button, screen goes blank after 19--21 seconds.  After 35ish seconds, phone vibrates slightly.  Released both buttons after vibration, reboot loop resumes within a few seconds.

4.  Attempted to hold down volume button, screen goes blank after a while with a small line appearing in the middle (like when you shut off an old TV set and the line appeared there) briefly.  This happens every 25 seconds or so until I release the volume button, and then the reboot loop resumes.

5.  Going to allow phone battery to drain completely and allow to sit for 12 hours, but doubtful that this will help (unless a full closed boot is required).

Edit:
6.  Able to enter boot menu (power and down volume); selected recovery mode.  Reboot loop resumes.

Can anyone offer any other suggestions on how to fix this?  Or does it seem likely that my beloved old pixel 1 is now a very slim brick?

Additional note:

Google logo does not animate in any way or form, static initial frame appears on screen.

title: How come that Google Pixel Phones don't have this feature?
content:
I'll go right to the point;

While a Pixel phone is locked (My pixel 2 XL), anybody is able to turn it off and it doesn't even ask for a PIN or anything... I see this as a lack of security because if you either forget the phone somewhere or it gets stolen, anybody will be able to turn it off and there wouldn't be any way to locate it... Do you follow me? Even the Samsung S7 has this feature I believe so. 

I thought that the Pixel 3 was going to have this feature but I was wrong. Please Google think about this and at least add it as something optional to have.

Who else has noticed this?

Thanks in advance!

title: I like to run my phone with "Display Size" set to "Largest" the only problem is the back button...
content:
I like to run my phone with "Display Size" set to "Largest". 
The only problem is the back-button's hot-area now extends all the way to the left edge of the screen which means the edge of my hand is constantly touching it.
It's incredibly annoying.
I can't use the keyboard without constantly cancelling the typing and quitting the app.
If I think about it I can grip the phone with a claw hand to make sure my palm doesn't touch the edge.
Also I can glue a piece of plastic to the corner of the screen. I actually did that for a while but it fell off.
I could also just give up on having this setting the way I want it which is what I'll probably just do.
"Larger" and "Largest" both suffer from the this problem. "Default" and "Large" are OK.
I imagine with would be particularly vexing for people with poor eyesight who actually need this feature and suddenly find their phone has become very difficult to use, so I would think this would be an accessibility issue Google would want to get on top of.
As I recall older versions of Android didn't have this issue, but I can't remember how long I've been living with it.
Does anyone have ideas for how to keep my settings the way I like them, but also add a "dead zone" on the bottom left corner of the screen?

content:

title: Black bars on wallpaper
content:
I used to have a Google Pixel (the original). Soon after I upgraded to Pie, my wallpaper started reverting to a certain (stock) wallpaper every day or every time it restarted. After it did that [assuming I didn't change the wallpaper back], the next day or next time it restarted, there would be a black bar across the bottom of the wallpaper on the home screen. Then every day or restart, the black bar would cover more and more of the screen until the wallpaper was only visible at the very top. [If I tried to change it back to a different wallpaper, the process started over--wallpaper change the next day, black bar appears, then gets bigger, etc.]

When I got the Pixel 3, for the first 2 weeks, it worked perfectly. Yesterday when I woke up, the wallpaper had reverted to the stock wallpaper that was showing when I first got the phone (the pink sky with mountains at the bottom). I changed it back to a (stock) wallpaper. This morning when I woke up, the wallpaper is now a different stock wallpaper (that I've used before, but not the one I set yesterday), AND there is a black bar covering nearly all of the screen.

I don't have any wallpaper apps installed (except Zedge, but I don't use their wallpaper). I had not downloaded any new apps or installed anything the day this started. The only thing that I can think of is that I had changed the lock screen (not the home screen) to one of my own photos for the first time; I had been using stock wallpapers exclusively for the last 2 weeks before that. 

Photo attached from today. I regret having deleted the screenshots from my old Pixel, but I thought the problem was solved when I got the Pixel 3.

title: Any way to fix bad rotation behavior on the app switching screen without disabling auto-rotate?
content:
This seems to be a problem whenever auto rotate is enabled.  By default the home-screen is landscape-only, which is fine and how I prefer it.  The issue is that this 'default' does not apply to the recent app view/app switcher.  

The way this behavior manifests is that if my phone is on a desk or other flat surface, it will be in portrait view in the home screen, but if I swipe up to get to the recent app view, there seems to be a 50/50 chance it will switch that specific view to landscape, turning everything 90 degrees and changing the direction needed to swipe to close etc.  

If you are holding the phone vertically in-front of you, its not an issue as obviously the sensor will indicate everything should remain portrait, but if it is on the desk you can't tell if the sensors feel it is technically 'portrait' or 'landscape' since its just laying flat there to begin with and you might as well flip a coin as to what orientation that the app switch screen will come up.

In prior versions of android that screen seemed to be 'informed' not just from the sensor but also what the orientation of the last 'view' or app you were in when you launched it.  i.e. if playing a game locked to landscape mode and opening that screen, it would still open landscape, even if the device was flat on a table and/or the 'sensor' last read was a portrait one.

In android 9 it seems like it always favors the sensor readings which is causing kind of random/guesswork behavior if the phone is set down and it means I kind of cringe every time I go to open the screen because I never know whether its going to sit there and then rotate 90 degrees on me or not.  So instead of a quick flick like the gesture is supposed to be its always a flick, sit there, wait, see if it turns, if it turns re-adjust my internal perspective and change all my swipe options by 90 degrees, or just try and pick the phone up off the desk to have it turn back etc, then swipe to the other/recent app I want. 

Either way it takes what used to be a half-second near-thoughtless navigation gesture and makes it a 4-5 second series of steps I need to focus/concentrate on.  Having the 'last seen' screens all be in their original orientation doesn't help matters because even if it switches to landscape view and navigation the apps will still 'look' portrait and its just the main phone status bar etc that will be visually rotated and serve as an indicator that the UI is now turned 90 degrees from what it was a half-second ago.

Basically instead of observing the orientation of the app (or home screen) that it is opening from, it is *always* subservient to the sensor data, which can disagree when the app is 'locking' the orientation (either portrait or landscape) and/or the sensor data is ambiguous (laying flat on a desk, so neither definitively portrait nor landscape) and that causes delays or directional ambiguity when they don't match and things start rotating in unexpected ways.
